channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: How does India, with 1.3 billion people, have only 1,000 virus deaths?
item.description: Less than a month ago, India's future looked dire.

item.title: Dozens of virus cases linked to US primary voting
Bill Gates predicts when we'll get a coronavirus vaccine
item.description: Bill Gates, philanthropist and founder of Microsoft, discusses the timeline for a potential vaccine for Covid-19.

item.title: China's model of control getting support during pandemic
Sweden says its coronavirus approach has worked. The numbers suggest a different story
Trump to order meat processing plants to stay open, even as they become virus hot spots
Pence goes maskless at Mayo Clinic but was told of mask policy, deleted tweet said
item.description: • Trump to order meat processing plants to stay open, even as they become hot spots

item.title: CNN medical correspondent shocked by Pence's move at hospital
item.description: Vice President Pence, who leads the White House's coronavirus task force, did not wear a mask while touring the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota despite being informed of that wearing a mask is part of the clinic's policy.

item.title: Why this former US senator isn't surprised by the new UFO tapes
Giant asteroid will fly by Earth on Wednesday, close enough to see by telescope
item.description: An asteroid estimated to be 1.2 miles wide will fly by Earth early Wednesday morning, but it's not expected to collide with our planet.

item.title: Life inside a 'Coronavirus Hotel'
item.description: Comedian Noam Shuster documented her experience recovering from Covid-19 while living in a hotel full of strangers in Israel. See how they became her live audience.

item.title: German doctors pose naked to protest protective equipment shortages
item.description: A website apparently featuring photos of German medical workers is calling attention to the working conditions and protective equipment needed by frontline workers amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How New Zealand says it has 'eliminated' the virus
item.description: After weeks of lockdown, New Zealand has achieved its ambitious goal of eliminating the coronavirus.

item.title: In this country, more people have been killed by the police enforcing curfew than coronavirus
item.description: Perched on his apartment balcony in Nairobi, 13-year-old Yassin Hussein Moyo curiously watched police patrol the streets with his mother and siblings. A coronavirus related curfew had just started when a stray bullet struck him in the stomach.

item.title: China is installing surveillance cameras outside homes ... and sometimes even inside
item.description: The morning after Ian Lahiffe returned to Beijing, he found a surveillance camera being mounted on the wall outside his apartment door. Its lens was pointing right at him.

item.title: UK government taken by surprise at Scotland's move
'Jeopardy!' contestant breaks unwritten show rule
item.description: "Jeopardy!" contestant Sarah Jett Rayburn broke new ground on the game show by interrupting host Alex Trebek during a key part of the show.

item.title: Tara Reade's ex-neighbor says Reade told her about Biden sexual assault allegation in 1990s
El Salvador president authorizes lethal force by police and military against gangs after deadly weekend
item.description: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele has authorized the use of lethal force by the police and army against gang members he says are taking advantage of the coronavirus pandemic, after a weekend of violence left at least 50 people dead across the country.

item.title: Watch Blue Angels and Thunderbirds salute first responders
item.description: US Navy and Airforce jets flew over NYC, PA, and NJ in honor of first responders on the frontlines of Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: 'Martyr of hunger': Protester dies as desperate Lebanese take to streets
Brazil's supreme court allows investigation of President Bolsonaro
item.description: Brazil's highest court has authorized an investigation into allegations that President Jair Bolsonaro sought to interfere with police investigations.

item.title: Fox's firing of Diamond & Silk isn't the problem. Fox's hiring of them is.
item.description: After a series of false and misleading statements about how to combat the coronavirus, Fox News parted way with sisters Lynette "Diamond" Hardaway and Rochelle "Silk" Richardson this week, according to the Daily Beast.

item.title: CNN's Tapper stunned by 'indecent and obscene' Trump retweet
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper and Dana Bash are both stunned by President Trump's retweet that suggests that his rivals are inflating coronavirus death rates to hurt his re-election chances.

item.title: This city may become one large outdoor café
item.description: Restaurants, cafés and bars in the Old Town of Vilnius, Lithuania, used to be fortunate to have a sidewalk table or two as part of their overall business operations.

item.title: Reporter inadvertently reveals he was wearing no pants on air
item.description: Most of us have lost count of the days we've been in quarantine, working at home in pajamas and forgetting when we last went outdoors.

item.title: Hong Kong airport provides a glimpse at the future of travel
item.description: Hong Kong International Airport has provided a glimpse into what post-coronavirus airport procedures might look like once we're traveling again, and a lot of disinfection technologies are involved.

item.title: Neighbors met during lockdown and found out they're related
item.description: California's coronavirus restrictions have brought together two families that found out that they're not just neighbors -- they're also related.

item.title: Covid-19 is killing more men than women. Can female hormones help men's symptoms?
item.description: CNN's Robyn Curnow interviews two scientists behind a study testing whether symptoms in male Covid-19 patients, who seem to be at a higher risk from the virus, can be reduced by treating them with estrogen.

item.title: Reporter explains why he doesn't walk out when Trump insults him
item.description: Brian Stelter asks: Why don't they just walk out when they're insulted? ABC White House correspondent Jonathan Karl, author of "Front Row at The Trump Show, says he gets asked that question often. "As reporters, our job is to be there," he says. "The insults don't matter. Who cares?" He says "we are there to try to get the facts and to put the questions to those who are in power in this country."

item.title: California city official who threw cat and drank during video meeting resigns
item.description: A Northern California city planning commissioner resigned on Tuesday following a videoconference meeting in which he was seen throwing his cat and drinking what appeared to be an alcoholic beverage.

item.title: 5 bodies found in a home after man called 911 and said his family was dead, police say
item.description: A man was arrested Monday after he called 911 and said "his family was dead," Milwaukee Police Chief Alfonso Morales said during a press conference.

item.title: Which languages are easiest -- and most difficult -- for native English speakers to master?
item.description: With so much time on our hands during lockdown, many of us have entertained the idea of expanding our horizons.

item.title: Mummies discovered in burial shaft in Egypt
item.description: Sarcophagi and wooden coffins containing human mummies are among the latest ancient finds to be uncovered by archeologists in Egypt. The finds were made in the Sacred Animal Necropolis in Saqqara, an ancient burial ground south of Cairo.

item.title: Reality TV star dies after car crash
item.description: Reality television star Ashley Ross, known as Ms. Minnie on Lifetime's "Little Women: Atlanta," died Monday from injuries sustained in a car accident, her publicist Liz Dixson told CNN.

item.title: 'There is nothing worse than hunger.' South Africa hero Siya Kolisi is helping townships during lockdown
item.description: South Africa's World Cup-winning captain Siya Kolisi remembers the sound of hunger gnawing in his belly when he was young. So, the man from the townships can certainly empathize with the pain lockdown is inflicting on the less fortunate in his country.

item.title: How, exactly, did the LA Lakers get a 'small business' loan?
item.description: The Paycheck Protection Program had a very simple goal: Keep small businesses afloat during the economic strife caused by the nationwide quarantine put in place to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: NASCAR driver's race cut short over daughter's mistake
item.description: NASCAR driver Denny Hamlin's race ended prematurely when his daughter pressed the power button on the remote, turning off the iRacing equipment he was using to participate.

item.title: 'What was I waiting for?' A procrastinator faces a lifetime of travel regrets
item.description: There are travel planners and travel procrastinators.

item.title: 10 years ago, this stranger saved me from a blizzard
item.description: Somewhere on that 7 a.m. Greyhound bus journey between Port Authority and Albany, I started crying.

item.title: Largest recorded hole in Arctic's ozone layer closes
item.description: An ozone hole that formed over the Arctic this spring and eventually grew into the largest ever recorded there has closed after splitting apart.

item.title: Priyanka Chopra's bold fashion has made her a global style icon
item.description: Priyanka Chopra is an actress, producer, philanthropist, singer and former Miss World. And, as has become evident in recent seasons, she is also a style icon.

item.title: Melissa McCarthy's dream about Mark Wahlberg may just come true
item.description: Melissa McCarthy recently had a dream Mark Wahlberg was quarantining in her house and the image was so strong, she actually had to check the guest room when she got up to see if he was in there.

item.title: Dozens of virus cases linked to US primary voting
UK government taken by surprise at Scotland's move
item.description: The Scottish government has advised people to wear face coverings in enclosed public spaces, in a break from the UK-wide approach to tackling the spread of coronavirus.

item.title: CNN's Acosta presses Trump on his virus predictions
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta reports on President Donald Trump's early predictions of coronavirus cases and compares them to the most recent US case toll of 1 million infections.

item.title: Masks on airplanes: Where things stand in the air
item.description: • Hong Kong airport provides glimpse of future

item.title: The pandemic is messing with our concept of time
item.description: "What day is it, again?"

item.title: Antibody tests have 'really terrible' accuracy, researcher says
item.description: Some antibody tests, which check for prior Covid-19 infection, had high rates of false positives in screenings performed by a consortium of California laboratories, according to a recently released report.

item.title: Tara Reade's ex-neighbor says Reade told her about Biden sex assault allegation in '90s
item.description: A former neighbor of Tara Reade, a woman who has accused Joe Biden of sexual assault, has come forward to say that Reade told her about the alleged assault in the mid-1990s. The account, purportedly told to the neighbor within a few years of the alleged incident, marks the first detailed and on-the-record corroboration of Reade's allegation against the presumptive Democratic nominee for president.
